intro: Acritopappus catolesensis, commonly known as the Catolesense acanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features slender, branching stems with lance-shaped leaves that have serrated edges. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces distinctive bracts that aid in seed dispersal. Acritopappus catolesensis is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks.
